timeline.bodyText: This can be done using the built in countries.denylist configurable.
timeline.author: Bentleysb

timeline.bodyText: This would be good as a configurable.
timeline.author: Bentleysb

timeline.bodyText: This would be good as a configurable.
timeline.author: Bentleysb

timeline.bodyText: This would be good as a configurable.
timeline.author: Bentleysb

timeline.bodyText: It would be great if edges that share an osm id could be grouped into one flag like here. For this to work properly it is also important to mark items as flagged by there osm ids.
timeline.author: Bentleysb

replies.bodyText: Also what are your thoughts on embedding a fix suggestion here to convert the tag to sign or markings? @mm-ciub
replies.author: seancoulter

replies.bodyText:
@Bentleysb I will start making the improvements, thank you.
@seancoulter, looking over taginfo I see that most cases have the value 'sign' at 21.30% while 'markings' is at 0.01%.  So perhaps a fix suggestion for sign could be added, but the user should assure that there is a sign present. Otherwise it falls under the zone source requiring the country:context format.
replies.author: mm-ciub

replies.bodyText: Ok thanks for the explanation. sounds like this might involve more research, and then we can open up an Issue if fix suggestions are found to be suitable
replies.author: seancoulter

timeline.author: seancoulter

timeline.message:
Added configurables and edge walking

- used already existing configurable country.denylist
- added configurables for values, context and country exceptions
- grouped edges with same id
- added unittest for the changes

Described configurables and added them to config file

- added values for configurables in configuration.json
- added description for each new configurable in check MD file
Added more unit tests for untouched conditions
Added missing iso_country_code tag in test rule
